title: Understanding Variance
text: Variance is a measure of how much the values in a data set differ from the mean. It is a key concept in statistics that helps us understand the spread of data points.

title: Population vs. Sample
text: When dealing with variance, it's important to distinguish between population variance and sample variance. Population variance considers all members of a group, while sample variance is calculated from a subset of the group.

title: Symbol Meaning
text: This symbol is commonly used in statistics to represent the spread of an entire population’s data points, and is squared to find the variance.

title: Identify the Correct Symbol
text: Which of the following symbols represents the variance of a population?
